LayoutNode.Content: A Wild Capybara in its Natural Habitat At NakedApartments we use capybara to write our behavior driven, end-to-end integration tests, aka “feature specs.” Capybara is a powerful tool that sets Continue Reading on top of a web driver. It offers you, the developer, a DSL that is used to write actions that closely mimic how an actual… Continue Reading

LayoutNode.Content: Posted by tbrown on January 12, 2018 in Web
LayoutNode.SRC: Posted by tbrown on January 12, 2018 in Web

LayoutNode.Content: Introduction This post will focus on a specific way of implementing one of the SOLID principles, Dependency Inversion. First, we should define Dependency Inversion. There are two major parts: Continue Reading High-level code should not depend on lower level code, both should depend upon abstractions. Abstractions should not depend on details, instead, details should depend on abstractions… Continue Reading High-level code should not depend on lower level code, both should depend upon abstractions. Abstractions should not depend on details, instead, details should depend on abstractions… Continue Reading

LayoutNode.Content: Package managers like NPM are a great way to find and share code; however, you have to be careful whenever you take a dependency. Each dependency you take comes with a cost; it is another Continue Reading potential source of bugs and breakage, and it requires more effort to update than your own source. If it’s not… Continue Reading
